metadata.title: AI Knowledge Tree | AI Teadmiste Puu

concept.prerequisiteHelp: Understanding these topics will help you better grasp this concept:
concept.pressEscToClose: Press ESC or click outside to close

tokenizer.title: Tokenizer Demo
tokenizer.subtitle: See how AI sees text
tokenizer.inputPlaceholder: Write something to see how AI tokenizes text...
tokenizer.infoText: Language models don't see text the way we do. They break text into smaller pieces called tokens. A token can be a word, part of a word, or even a single character. This demo shows a simplified version!
tokenizer.costTip: Tip: Longer texts = more tokens = higher cost. Learn to optimize your prompts!
tokenizer.disclaimer: This is a simplified tokenizer. Real language models use more sophisticated methods like BPE (Byte Pair Encoding) or WordPiece.

search.instructions: Use arrow keys to navigate, Enter to select, and Escape to close

vectorDemo.title: Vector Similarity Demo
vectorDemo.subtitle: Explore how AI understands word meanings
vectorDemo.visualizationAriaLabel: 2D visualization of word similarities in vector space
vectorDemo.visualizationHint: Words closer together are more similar in meaning. Hover over points for details.
vectorDemo.infoText: AI represents words as vectors (lists of numbers) called embeddings. Similar words have similar vectors. This demo uses simplified 10-dimensional vectors, but real models like GPT use 1,536+ dimensions! The 2D plot shows these high-dimensional relationships projected into a space we can see.
vectorDemo.disclaimer: This demo uses pre-computed simplified embeddings. Real AI models create embeddings dynamically based on context and use thousands of dimensions for more nuanced understanding.
